original_title: AKD could be sworn in as Sri Lanka President today if result is finalized
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Anura Kumara Dissanayake could be sworn in as President of Sri Lanka later on Sunday, a National Peoples Power official said, though the timing was uncertain.
It is not clear whether a second count is needed.  A second count would delay the declaration of results.
“Very few people have given preferences, according to the information we have it is about 5,000 to 1 in some places,” the official said.
“The gap between AKD and the second candidate is so large that the second count would make no difference.
By around 8.30 am with 1.6 mm votes counted, Dissanayake was slightly below 50 percent.
Elections Commission officials said last week that they hoped to declare a final winner on Sunday September 22.  (Colombo/Aug22/2024)
